question: what are main types muscles in shoulder girdle
generated_answer: The main types of muscles in the shoulder girdle are the global movers and the local stabilizers. Global movers are responsible for moving the joints of the shoulder girdle in all directions and consist mainly of fast-twitched muscle fibers that are good at generating force and speed. Local stabilizers, on the other hand, consist mainly of endurance slow twitch muscle fibers, which stabilize the joints of the shoulder girdle in its optimal position so the global movers can generate force efficiently.
